intro: Rhytidocaulon, commonly known as the tree of life, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rhytidocaulonaceae. These plants are characterized by their unique, often succulent stems and leaves that may exhibit a wrinkled or pitted appearance. They are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in shaded, moist environments. The flowers are usually small and clustered, with some species producing fragrant blooms. Rhytidocaulon species are of interest to botanists due to their distinctive morphology and ecological adaptations.
